item.title: Confidence Intervals and Hypothesis Testing in OLS Linear Regression
item.description: See also: Confidence Intervals and Hypothesis Testing Motivation. Assume we have our estimators for our sample size N using OLS, β0​,β1​^​^​. Now, assuming we have the true population data (impossible in real life) and take 100 samples of size N from the whole population, we get 100 different tuple of estimators (β0​^​,β1​^​).

item.title: Consistency
item.description: def. Consisteny. An estimator θ^(X1​,…,Xn​) is consistent for parameter θ if: ∀ϵ>0, θ^ p⟶​n→∞​ θi.e.n→∞lim​P(∣θ^−θ∣<ϵ)=1n→∞lim​P(∣θ^−θ∣>ϵ)=0 ![[スクリーンショット 2023-02-21 15.

item.title: Consumer Sentiment Index
item.description: University of Michigan performs a monthly telephone survey about how the households feel about the economic climate.

item.title: Consumer Surplus
item.description: Consumer Surplus § Marginal Willingness to Pay Curve leads naturally to the concept of consumer surplus. Follow the following line of logic: The area under the MWTP curve is the Total Willingness to Pay (TWTP)—the amount the consumer was willing to pay to get q amount of goods.

item.title: Contagion (Finance)
item.description: := a propogation of bear markets, due to the fact that banks lend and borrow from each other → The higher the leverage, the greater the degree of contagion in markets.

item.title: Context-Free Grammar
item.description: Section: Pushdown Automata def. a Context-Free Grammar (CFG) is a grammar whose production rules consist of: A→x …where A is a variable, and x is a string of variables and terminals.

item.title: Context-Free Language
item.description: Section: Pushdown Automata Closure Properties § Context-Free Languages are closed under: Union Concat Star Regular Intersection (←think: you have states & one stack to combine.
